hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major regulatory announcement, CPI print, Fed speech), a sharp, high-volume price spike (>3% in 15 minutes) that fails to sustain and retraces >50% within the next 2 hours will lead to a mean-reverting move back through the pre-spike high/low over the subsequent 4-6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news often triggers knee-jerk algorithmic and emotional reactions, creating an 'overshoot'. When this move fails to hold, it suggests the initial interpretation was exaggerated. The retracement and subsequent break of the pre-spike level indicates the dominant market narrative has reasserted itself, targeting the liquidity beyond the initial false spike.
entry_conditions: Price retraces >50% of the initial spike move within 120 minutes
Entry on close of 5-min candle that breaks the high (for bullish spike) or low (for bearish spike) of the candle immediately preceding the initial spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Target: Pre-spike high + 0.5*ATR(14) for long, Pre-spike low - 0.5*ATR(14) for short

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The hypothesis is falsified if, after the entry signal, price fails to reach the take-profit target within 6 hours more than 55% of the time in a backtest of >50 qualified events, or if the average win/loss ratio is <1.2.
